intro: Desmidorchis somalica, commonly known as the Somali orchid, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique floral structure and specialized growth habits. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to its harsh native habitat. Its flowers are usually small and inconspicuous, with a distinct coloration that aids in pollination by specific insect species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat vulnerability, it is considered a critically endangered species.
